title: EDS Decision Making Under Time Pressure
operationalFocus: Critical decision-making when disconnect may be required
question: On {{wellProfile.wellName}} in {{wellProfile.waterDepth.value}} {{wellProfile.waterDepth.unit}} water depth, you are drilling at {{currentSection.settingDepth.tvd}} {{currentSection.settingDepth.unit}} TVD. The DP system alarms - vessel is experiencing {{scenario.event}}. You have approximately {{scenario.timeToLimit}} minutes before riser angle exceeds {{scenario.angleLimit}}Â°. Current well status: {{scenario.wellStatus}}. Pipe position: {{scenario.pipePosition}}. What is your action?

steps: Space out pipe to position pipe body across BSR
If kick in progress, attempt to secure well conventionally first
Prepare for EDS but don't execute unless situation deteriorates
Monitor vessel position - be ready to execute immediately
Verify riser tensioner in disconnect mode
If pipe can be moved in time, space out
If not enough time, accept current pipe position and execute EDS
Do not attempt to move pipe - not enough time
Execute EDS regardless of pipe position
BSR may not fully shear tool joint - accept this risk vs certain riser damage

answerOptions.A: Execute EDS immediately regardless of time available
answerOptions.B: Never disconnect - vessel damage is preferable to well control risk
answerOptions.C: Assess time available: with >15 min attempt controlled response, with <5 min execute EDS immediately
answerOptions.D: Wait until riser angle actually exceeds limits before taking action

feedback.correct: Correct. EDS decision-making is about time. With time, you can optimize - space out pipe, attempt to control kicks conventionally. Without time, you execute and accept the compromises. Waiting too long risks riser damage AND an uncontrolled disconnect.
feedback.A_feedback: Premature EDS when time is available wastes the opportunity to position pipe correctly and possibly secure the well conventionally.
feedback.B_feedback: This is never acceptable. Riser damage from over-angle can lead to uncontrolled release, injured personnel, and environmental disaster.
feedback.D_feedback: Waiting until limits are exceeded means you've already failed. You need lead time for the sequence to complete.

contextualTip: On {{wellProfile.wellName}}, with {{wellProfile.bopInfo.workingPressure}} psi BOP in {{wellProfile.waterDepth.value}} {{wellProfile.waterDepth.unit}} water, EDS is your last barrier. Know your BSR shear rating and what pipe it can cut. A tool joint across the rams may not shear cleanly.
advancedNote: Post-Macondo, EDS systems have multiple backups (deadman, autoshear, acoustic, ROV). But primary execution by the driller remains fastest. Drill this scenario regularly - you won't have time to read the procedure when it's real.
